FacilityName: Castle & Cooke Cold Storage - Coppell Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Castle & Cooke Cold Storage has and will continue to be concerned with all aspects of the environment, health, and safety issues.  We focus our attention and resources towards the protection of our employees and the surrounding community.
  

Castle & Cooke Cold Storage is also involved in an ongoing effort to comply with regulations at the local, state and federal levels that require accident prevention, planning, training, and response.  The facility is located at 777 Freeport Parkway, Coppell, Texas and is equipped with a refrigeration system that contains anhydrous ammonia (C.A.S. #7664-41-7). Ammonia is the sole regulated substance in regard to the aforementioned regulations.  The maximum quantity of ammonia in the system does not exceed 25,000 pounds.

Releases are prevented by a combination of engineering and administrative controls.  Administrative controls involve manual isolation and shutdown procedures to be performed by trained personnel.  The system is also equipped with pressure relief valves that operate to prevent damage to system components should pressure reach unsafe leves.  Operation of pressure relief valves will result in a controlled release of refrigerant.

This facility has not experienced any reportable accidents in the past five (5) years. Incidental releases may occur during routine engineering activiites.

Written emergecy procedures are maintainted at our facility. All employees are trained to act based on their pre-assigned roles during emergency situations.  Castel & Cooke Cold Storage works with the Coppell Fire Department in the event of an emergency.

Planned changes to improve safety include the ongoing preventative maintenance program, and regular replacement of deteriorated system components.  In all cases, improved process technology is employed where feasible.  Employees levels of awareness is enhanced by regular training programs and exercises.
